Torrent is great. Audio and Video both very good, and for those who asked, it does feature english subtitles for the non-english parts.

The movie, however, is terrible. Worst shit I've ever seen. Glad I didn't have to pay to watch it.

And also: I run on a pretty bad internet conection, and downloaded it in less than 2 hours, so seeders are not a problem. Stop complaining!

I hate to have a comment conv', but whatever... If they had just said "worst ever", no, but, if they said the bit, about Jet Li, yes, I would've avoided it. this is very much a stallone movie, the others have very bit parts. And I, personally, do not like stallone. But, many do, and they would probably enjoy this film.

And, I suggest not stopping; I've found very many virus comments, on here, and when one sees that, they should avoid the torrent. Yes, the person could be lying, but... they could be telling the truth, too. So... I'd rather be safe. you could try ignoring the people's opinion(s), though.

I don't know if it's the worst, ever, though. I mean... it's the most misleading... and it's certainly bad... But, without having seen /all/ films, I cannot accurately judge. But, it is the worst film, that I've managed to sit through, that I remember.

Oh, and, the film rating: 4/10

To All: They are trying to pass a new Ridiculous law! The Information is on The Front Page of Demonoid! It says:

COICA

In the United States, a new law proposal called The Combating Online Infringement and Counterfeits Act (COICA) was introduced last week, and there will be a hearing in front of the Judiciary Committee this Thursday.

If passed, this law will allow the government, under the command of the media companies, to censor the internet as they see fit, like China and Iran do, with the difference that the sites they decide to censor will be completely removed from the internet and not just in the US.

Please see the following article from the Huffington Post for more information.

Stop the Internet Blacklist

And if you are a US citizen, please take the time to sign this petition
DemandProgress.org - Petition to Stop the Internet Blacklist!


Update: Also for US citizens, you can email your Senator from the following link and tell him or her your concerns about this bill

Tell Your Senator: No Website Blacklists, No Internet Censorship!
